If all diseases were cured, the world population would continue to grow exponentially, leading to a strain on resources and potentially causing overpopulation.
The cure for diseases could lead to a decrease in the genetic diversity of the population, as certain traits that are associated with certain diseases could be lost.
Without diseases to keep us in check, people may not be as motivated to live a healthy lifestyle and take care of their bodies.
The cure for diseases could lead to a significant decrease in medical research and development, as there would be no longer be a need to study and treat diseases.
If all diseases were cured, the economy could be significantly impacted, as the healthcare industry would have to adapt to a new reality where people are not getting sick as often.
